Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rev. Suzan Johnson Cook, Believers Christian Fellowship Church, 2031 Fifth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10031.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Suzan Johnson Cook, Believers Christian Fellowship Church, 2031 Fifth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10031.

Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 28, 2007 be adopted and printed by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Garodnick moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 28, 2007 be adopted as printed.

By Council Member Gerson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number C 070132 PPM, shall be subject to Council review.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact the Local Law Enforcement Hate Crimes Prevention Act of 2007, which would provide federal assistance to states and local jurisdictions to prosecute hate crimes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Congress to reintroduce and pass the Local Law Enforcement Hate Crimes Prevention Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending alternate side of the street parking regulations during snow storms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Suspending alternate side of the street parking regulations during snow storms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to issuance of a certificate of completion for individuals working on supported scaffolds and design requirements for supported scaffolds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Issuance of a certificate of completion for individuals working on supported scaffolds and design requirements for supported scaffolds.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for violations of the littering law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for violations of the littering law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the issuance of notices of violations during certain times.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Limiting the issuance of notices of violations during certain times.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of New York City to oppose the institution of any form of congestion pricing.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Mayor of New York City to oppose the institution of any form of congestion pricing.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting New York State Assembly Bill A.5334, which would establish a program to coordinate the donation of excess food from school meal programs to voluntary food assistance programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Establish a program to coordinate the donation of excess food from school meal programs to voluntary food assistance programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to reintroduce and the President of the United States to enact into law the “Religious Freedom Peace Tax Fund Act,” to affirm the religious freedom of taxpayers who are conscientiously opposed to participation in war and to provide that the income, estate or gift tax payments of such taxpayers be used for nonmilitary purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: “Religious Freedom Peace Tax Fund Act”

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 39th Anniversary of the death of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. on April 4, 2007.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 39th Anniversary of the death of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. on April 4, 2007.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing March as Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Recognizing March as Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month in the City of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to inspection cycles for exterior walls.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring that critical examinations of building facades for buildings greater than six stories in height take place on a five-year cycle starting from the year in which the building was erected.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation to address the financial hardships placed upon New York residents who are members of the militia, national guard or armed services reserves.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Address the financial hardships placed upon NY residents who are members of the militia, national guard or armed services reserves.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to consult with educators, parents, community leaders and other interested stakeholders regarding the recent school reforms, and to delay the implementation of these reforms until the potential impact has been fully assessed.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: School reforms, and to delay the implementation of these reforms until the potential impact has been fully assessed.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States federal government to preserve immediate and non-contingent Medicaid eligibility for children born in the United States to undocumented immigrants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: US federal government to preserve immediate and non-contingent Medicaid eligibility for children born in the US to undocumented immigrants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: An owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Governor of the State of New York to issue an Executive Order to the State Agencies under his control mandating the procurement of Recycled Plastic Lumber (RPL) where it is a viable alternative to natural or chemically treated wood and urging the State Legislature to enact legislation mandating municipalities to do the same.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Mandating the procurement of Recycled Plastic Lumber (RPL) where it is a viable and potentially economically efficient alternative to natural or chemically treated wood.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to alteration permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Alteration Permits

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to examination and application of plans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Examination and application of plans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation to increase the number of Family Court judges in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Increase the number of Family Court judges in New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass S. 453, the “Deceptive Practices and Voter Intimidation Prevention Act of 2007,” introduced by Senator Barack Obama, which prohibits deceptive practices in Federal elections.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass S. 453, the “Deceptive Practices and Voter Intimidation Prevention Act of 2007."

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to school bus safety.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: School bus safety.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, inrelation to the establishment of the Court-Livingston-Schermerhorn business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Court-Livingston-Schermerhorn Business Improvement District

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Volunteer Ambulance Workers’ Benefit Law to include volunteer ambulance workers who render aid at the request of the City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Volunteer Ambulance Workers’ Benefit Law to include volunteer ambulance workers who render aid at the request of the City.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Court-Livingston-Schermerhorn Business Improvement District in the Borough of Brooklyn and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Court-Livingston-Schermerhorn BID, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 070257 HAX, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located on Sites 23 and 31 within the Melrose Commons URA and Site 14A within the Mott Haven North, and the disposition of the city-owned property, Borough of the Bronx, Council Districts no. 16 and 17. This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).

Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individuals:

Nicholas Pekearo, 28 and Eugene Marshalik, 19, boh volunteer members of the NYC Auxiliary Police, who were shot and killed in Greenwich Village on March 14, 2007 after trying to apprehend a perpetrator who had just murdered pizza employee Alfredo Romero.
